title: Setup .gitignore and .editorconfig
description: Create comprehensive .gitignore for Python projects (venv, __pycache__, .pytest_cache, dist/, build/, *.egg-info, .coverage, etc.) and .editorconfig for consistent coding styles across editors.

comments.author: jared@goatbytes.io
comments.content:
Setup .gitignore and .editorconfig:

**.gitignore:**
- Already comprehensive with Python best practices
- Covers: __pycache__, venv, dist, build, *.egg-info
- Includes: pytest_cache, coverage, mypy_cache, ruff_cache
- Handles: Poetry, PDM, UV, pip, virtualenv
- IDE support: .idea (commented), .vscode (commented)
- No changes needed - already production-ready

**.editorconfig:**
- Root configuration for consistent coding styles
- Python: 4-space indent, 88 char line length (matches Ruff)
- YAML/TOML/JSON: 2-space indent
- Universal: UTF-8, LF line endings, trim trailing whitespace
- Markdown: Preserve trailing whitespace (for line breaks)
- Makefile: Tab indentation

Configuration ensures consistent formatting across all editors.
